message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about the physical properties of objects and how temperature changes can affect them. When a warm glass is placed in the fridge, it will begin to cool down. As it cools, the air inside the fridge will come into contact with the colder glass and condensate, forming droplets of water on the surface of the glass. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) condensate. Option (A) is incorrect because a warm glass placed in the fridge will not emit light or glow. Option (C) is incorrect because the glass itself will not shrink due to being placed in the fridge. Option (D) is incorrect because unless there is a significant temperature difference and thermal shock, the glass should not crack from being placed in the fridge.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the behavior of materials when exposed to temperature changes. When a warm glass is placed in the fridge, it will cause condensation to form on its surface. This is because the warm air inside the glass cools down and cannot hold as much moisture, so the excess moisture condenses on the surface of the glass. Option (A) is incorrect because a glass does not glow when placed in the fridge. Option (C) is incorrect because the glass will not shrink due to being placed in the fridge. Option (D) is incorrect because the glass is unlikely to crack solely from being placed in the fridge, unless there are significant temperature differences or defects in the glass.
